title: Black Devil
credit_line: Gift of Aluminum Company of America
provenance_text:
Kumi Sugaï [1919-1996], Paris, France [1]. G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA, ca. 1961 but by January 1962 until June 26, 1965 [2]; G. David Thompson estate, June 1965 until November 1966 [3]; The Aluminum Company of America, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1966-April 11,1967; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute Pittsburgh, PA, April 1967.

Notes:
[1]. The Japanese artist Sugai lived and worked in Paris for many years.
[2]. The work was exhibited (no. 383, illustrated in the catalogue) in the 1961 Carnegie International.  A letter from the director of the Carnegie Institute (copy in curatorial file) states that the painting had not been sold from the International as of December 8, 1961.
[3]. Part of the Alcoa Collection of Contemporary Art.  This work was included in an exhibition of works acquired by Alcoa from the G. David Thompson collection (no. 52) held at Carnegie Institute in 1967, followed by a multi-year national tour.
